title: How to Use a Cardboard Drink Holder to Hold Picnic Condiments

steps.headline: Store a pile of pre-used cardboard drink holders.
steps.description: Maintain a supply only of the gently used drink holders. Anything with rips or damaged should be recycled.

steps.headline: Evaluate which fast food restaurant distributes the most handy drink holders.
steps.description: Request a drink holder whenever you visit, even if you only one or two drinks.

steps.headline: Visit a restaurant supply store for a supply to keep on-hand.
steps.description: If you buy in bulk you can use the drink holders for multiple uses.

methods.name: Prepare the Drink Holder for Picnic Use

steps.headline: Select the items that you would like to include in your drink holder caddy.
steps.description: Examples include ketchup, mustard, salt, pepper, utensils and paper napkins.

steps.headline: Transfer condiments to a drink holder-friendly container.
steps.description: For example, if the bottle of ketchup is overly large you could pour ketchup in a red bottle with a nozzle for ease of use. If containers are not obvious as to what they are, create a labeling system or decorate the bottles with pictures of the item (for example, paste a picture of a ketchup bottle on the ketchup container).

steps.headline: Arrange items in the drink holder for easy access and use.
steps.description: For example, condiments like ketchup and mustard can be located on one side and then you could even wrap place settings/utensils inside paper napkins.

text: Select Your Cardboard Drink Holder Store a pile of pre-used cardboard drink holders. Maintain a supply only of the gently used drink holders. Anything with rips or damaged should be recycled. Evaluate which fast food restaurant distributes the most handy drink holders. Request a drink holder whenever you visit, even if you only one or two drinks. Visit a restaurant supply store for a supply to keep on-hand. If you buy in bulk you can use the drink holders for multiple uses. Prepare the Drink Holder for Picnic Use Select the items that you would like to include in your drink holder caddy. Examples include ketchup, mustard, salt, pepper, utensils and paper napkins. Transfer condiments to a drink holder-friendly container. For example, if the bottle of ketchup is overly large you could pour ketchup in a red bottle with a nozzle for ease of use. If containers are not obvious as to what they are, create a labeling system or decorate the bottles with pictures of the item (for example, paste a picture of a ketchup bottle on the ketchup container). Arrange items in the drink holder for easy access and use. For example, condiments like ketchup and mustard can be located on one side and then you could even wrap place settings/utensils inside paper napkins. Finished.
